messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Go (Golang) and the Gin (github.com/gin-gonic/gin) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `hello.go`, I found that `users.ProfileRegister` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/profiles`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `hello.go`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `users.ProfileRegister`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the handler implementations:
- users/routers.go

Explanation:
- I searched the codebase for "ProfileRegister" (grep). Matches were found in hello.go (route usage), users/routers.go (definition/implementation), and users/unit_test.go (test reference).
- I opened users/routers.go and confirmed it defines ProfileRegister and the actual handler functions ProfileRetrieve, ProfileFollow, and ProfileUnfollow (the implementations that process requests to /api/profiles).
- The unit_test.go match is a test reference and does not contain the production handler implementations, so I ignored it per your instructions.

Commands used (for traceability):
- grep -R "ProfileRegister" -n
- sed -n '1,240p' users/routers.go

I did not run any project source code; I only inspected files.
